register.description: This register contains the IP revision code.

bitfield.description: TI internal data. Identifies revision of peripheral.

register.description: Register related to module software reset and local power management.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

0h = Force-idle. A clock stop request is acknowledged unconditionally. 1h (R/W) = No-idle. A clock stop request is never acknowledged. 2h (R/W) = Smart-idle. Acknowledgment to a clock stop request is given based on the internal activity of the module. 3h (R/W) = Reserved. Do not use.
Write 0 for future compatibility Read returns 0.
Software reset. 0h (R/W) = Normal mode 1h (R/W) = The module is reset.
Internal interface clock-gating strategy 0h (R/W) = Interface clock is free-running. 1h (R/W) = Automatic Interface clock gating strategy is applied, based on the interconnect activity.

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Read returns 0 (reserved for interconnect-socket status information).
Internal reset monitoring 0h (R) = Internal module reset is ongoing. 1h (R) = Reset is complete.

register.description: This interrupt status register regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Status of the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt Write: 0h = WAIT1EDGEDETECTIONSTATUS bit is unchanged. 1h = WAIT1EDGEDETECTIONSTATUS bit is reset. Read: 0h = A transition on WAIT1 input pin has not been detected. 1h = A transition on WAIT1 input pin has been detected.

Status of the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt Write: 0h = WAIT0EDGEDETECTIONSTATUS bit is unchanged. 1h = WAIT0EDGEDETECTIONSTATUS bit is reset. Read: 0h = A transition on WAIT0 input pin has not been detected. 1h = A transition on WAIT0 input pin has been detected.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Status of the TerminalCountEvent interrupt Write: 0h = TERMINALCOUNTSTATUS bit is unchanged. 1h = TERMINALCOUNTSTATUS bit is reset. Read: 0h = Indicates that CountValue is greater than 0. 1h = Indicates that CountValue is equal to 0.
Status of the FIFOEvent interrupt Write: 0h = FIFOEVENTSTATUS bit is unchanged. 1h = FIFOEVENTSTATUS bit is reset. Read: 0h = Indicates that less than 1h = Indicates that at least

register.description: The interrupt enable register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on a event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Enables the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt 0h (R/W) = Wait1EdgeDetection interrupt is masked. 1h (R/W) = Wait1EdgeDetection event generates an interrupt if occurs.
Enables the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt 0h (R/W) = Wait0EdgeDetection interrupt is masked. 1h (R/W) = Wait0EdgeDetection event generates an interrupt if occurs.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Enables TerminalCountEvent interrupt issuing in prefetch or write-posting mode 0h (R/W) = TerminalCountEvent interrupt is masked. 1h (R/W) = TerminalCountEvent interrupt is not masked.
Enables the FIFOEvent interrupt 0h (R/W) = FIFOEvent interrupt is masked. 1h (R/W) = FIFOEvent interrupt is not masked.

register.description: The register allows the user to set the start value of the timeout counter.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Start value of the time-out counter
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Enable bit of the TimeOut feature 0h (R/W) = TimeOut feature is disabled. 1h (R/W) = TimeOut feature is enabled.

register.description: The register stores the address of the illegal access when an error occurs.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Address of illegal access

register.description: The register stores the type of error when an error occurs.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
System command of the transaction that caused the error
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Not supported address error 0h (R) = No error occurs. 1h (R) = The error is due to a nonsupported address.
Not supported command error 0h (R) = No error occurs. 1h (R) = The error is due to a nonsupported command
Time-out error 0h (R) = No error occurs. 1h (R) = The error is due to a timeout.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Error validity status - Must be explicitly cleared with a write 1 transaction 0h (R/W) = All error fields no longer valid 1h (R/W) = Error detected and logged in the other error fields

register.description: The configuration register allows global configuration of the GPMC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT1 0h (R/W) = WAIT1 active low 1h (R/W) = WAIT1 active high
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT0 0h (R/W) = WAIT0 active low 1h (R/W) = WAIT0 active high
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Controls the WP output pin level 0h (R/W) = nWP output pin is low 1h (R/W) = nWP output pin is high
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Enables the Force Posted Write feature to NAND Cmd/Add/Data location 0h (R/W) = Disables Force Posted Write 1h (R/W) = Enables Force Posted Write

register.description: The status register provides global status bits of the GPMC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Is a copy of input pin WAIT1. (Reset value is WAIT1 input pin sampled at device reset.) 0h (R) = WAIT1 asserted (inactive state) 1h (R) = WAIT1 deasserted
Is a copy of input pin WAIT0. (Reset value is WAIT0 input pin sampled at device reset.) 0h (R) = WAIT0 asserted (inactive state) 1h (R) = WAIT0 deasserted
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads returns 0
Stores the empty status of the write buffer 0h (R) = Write buffer is not empty. 1h (R) = Write buffer is empty.

register.description: The configuration register 1 sets signal control parameters per chip-select. Offset = 60h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Enables the wrapping burst capability. Must be set if the attached device is configured in wrapping burst 0h (R/W) = Synchronous wrapping burst not supported 1h (R/W) = Synchronous wrapping burst supported
Selects the read single or multiple access 0h (R/W) = Single access 1h (R/W) = Multiple access (burst if synchronous, page if asynchronous)
Selects the read mode operation 0h (R/W) = Read asynchronous 1h (R/W) = Read synchronous
Selects the write single or multiple access 0h (R/W) = Single access 1h (R/W) = Multiple access (burst if synchronous, considered as single if asynchronous)
Selects the write mode operation 0h (R/W) = Write asynchronous 1h (R/W) = Write synchronous

Output GPMC CLK activation time 0h (R/W) = First rising edge of GPMC CLK at start access time 1h (R/W) = First rising edge of GPMC CLK one GPMC_FICLK cycle after start access time 2h (R/W) = First rising edge of GPMC CLK two GPMC_FICLK cycles after start access time 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Specifies the attached device page (burst) length 0h (R/W) = 4 words 1h (R/W) = 8 words 2h (R/W) = 16 words 3h (R/W) = Reserved (1 word = interface size)
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Read accesses 0h (R/W) = WAIT pin is not monitored for read accesses. 1h (R/W) = WAIT pin is monitored for read accesses.
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Write accesses 0h (R/W) = WAIT pin is not monitored for write accesses. 1h (R/W) = WAIT pin is monitored for write accesses.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

Selects input pin Wait monitoring time 0h (R/W) = WAIT pin is monitored with valid data. 1h (R/W) = WAIT pin is monitored one GPMC CLK cycle before valid data. 2h (R/W) = WAIT pin is monitored two GPMC CLK cycle before valid data. 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Selects the input WAIT pin for this chip-select 0h (R/W) = Wait input pin is WAIT0. 1h (R/W) = Wait input pin is WAIT1. 2h, 3h = Reserved
Write 0s for future compatibility.
Selects the device size attached 0h (R/W) = 8 bit 1h (R/W) = 16 bit 2h (R/W) = Reserved 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Selects the attached device type 0h (R/W) = NOR flash-like, asynchronous and synchronous devices 1h (R/W) = Reserved 2h (R/W) = NAND flash-like devices, stream mode 3h (R/W) = Reserved

Enables the address and data multiplexed protocol 0h (R/W) = Nonmultiplexed attached device 1h (R/W) = AAD-multiplexed protocol device 2h (R/W) = Address and data multiplexed attached device 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Signals timing latencies scalar factor (RD/WRCYCLETIME, RD/WRACCESSTIME, PAGEBURSTACCESSTIME, CSONTIME, CSRD/WROFFTIME, ADVONTIME, ADVRD/WROFFTIME, OEONTIME, OEOFFTIME, WEONTIME, WEOFFTIME, CYCLE2CYCLEDELAY, BUSTURNAROUND, TIMEOUTSTARTVALUE, WRDATAONADMUXBUS) 0h (R/W) = x1 latencies 1h (R/W) = x2 latencies
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Divides the GPMC_FICLK clock 0h (R/W) = GPMC CLK frequency = GPMC_FICLK frequency 1h (R/W) = GPMC CLK frequency = GPMC_FICLK frequency / 2 2h (R/W) = GPMC CLK frequency = GPMC_FICLK frequency / 3 3h (R/W) = GPMC CLK frequency = GPMC_FICLK frequency /4

register.description: CS signal timing parameter configuration Offset = 64h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.
CS i deassertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
CS i de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
CS i Add extra half-GPMC_FICLK cycle 0h (R/W) = CS i Timing control signal is not delayed 1h (R/W) = CS i Timing control signal is delayed of half GPMC_FICLK clock cycle
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
CS i assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: nADV signal timing parameter configuration Offset = 68h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nADV deassertion for first address phase when using the AAD-multiplexed protocol
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nADV assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-multiplexed protocol
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nADV deassertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nADV deassertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
nADV add extra half-GPMC_FICLK cycle 0h (R/W) = nADV timing control signal is not delayed 1h (R/W) = nADV timing control signal is delayed of half GPMC_FICLK clock cycle
nADV assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-multiplexed protocol
nADV assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: nWE and nOE signals timing parameter configuration Offset = 6Ch + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nWE deassertion time from start cycle time
nWE add extra half-GPMC_FICLK cycle 0h (R/W) = nWE timing control signal is not delayed 1h (R/W) = nWE timing control signal is delayed of half-GPMC_FICLK clock cycle
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
nWE assertion time from start cycle time
nOE deassertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-multiplexed access
nOE deassertion time from start cycle time
nOE add extra half-GPMC_FICLK cycle 0h (R/W) = nOE timing control signal is not delayed 1h (R/W) = nOE timing control signal is delayed of half-GPMC_FICLK clock cycle
nOE assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-mux access
nOE assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: RdAccessTime and CycleTime timing parameters configuration Offset = 70h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Delay between successive words in a multiple access
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Delay between start cycle time and first data valid
Write 0s for future compatibility.
Total write cycle time
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Total read cycle time

register.description: WrAccessTime, WrDataOnADmuxBus, Cycle2Cycle and BusTurnAround parameters configuration Offset = 74h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: TI Internal use - Do not modify.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Delay from start access time to the GPMC_FICLK rising edge corresponding the GPMC CLK rising edge used by the attached memory for the first data capture
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Specifies on which GPMC_FICLK rising edge the first data of the write is driven in the add/data mux bus
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Chip-select high pulse delay between successive accesses
Add CYCLE2CYCLEDELAY between successive accesses to the same chip-select (any access type) 0h (R/W) = No delay between the two accesses 1h (R/W) = Add CYCLE2CYCLEDELAY
Add CYCLE2CYCLEDELAY between successive accesses to a different chip-select (any access type) 0h (R/W) = No delay between the two accesses 1h (R/W) = Add CYCLE2CYCLEDELAY
Write 0s for future compatibility.
Bus turnaround latency between successive accesses to the same chip-select (read to write) or to a different chip-select (read to read and read to write)

register.description: CS address mapping configuration Offset = 78h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
CS mask address.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
CS enable 0h (R/W) = CS disabled 1h (R/W) = CS enabled
CSi base address where i = 0 to 3 (16-MB minimum granularity) bits [5-0] corresponds to A29, A28, A27, A26, A25, and A24. See

register.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Offset = 7Ch + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Writing data at the

register.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Offset = 80h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Writing data at the

register.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Offset = 84h + (i * 30h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: This register is not a true register, only an address location. Reading data from the

register.description: Prefetch engine configuration 1 Some of the GPMC features described in this section may not be supported on this family of devices. For more information, see , GPMC Not Supported Features.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Define the number of GPMC_FICLK cycles to be subtracted from RDCYCLETIME, WRCYCLETIME, RDACCESSTIME, CSRDOFFTIME, CSWROFFTIME, ADVRDOFFTIME, ADVWROFFTIME, OEOFFTIME, WEOFFTIME
Enables access cycle optimization 0h (R/W) = Access cycle optimization is disabled. 1h (R/W) = Access cycle optimization is enabled.
Selects the chip-select where Prefetch Postwrite engine is active
Enables the PFPW RoundRobin arbitration 0h (R/W) = Prefetch Postwrite engine round robin arbitration is disabled. 1h (R/W) = Prefetch Postwrite engine round robin arbitration is enabled.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
When an arbitration occurs between a DMA and a PFPW engine access, the DMA is always serviced. If the PFPWEnRoundRobin is enabled,
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Selects the maximum number of bytes read from the FIFO or written to the FIFO by the host on a DMA or interrupt request
Enables the Prefetch Postwite engine 0h (R/W) = Prefetch Postwrite engine is disabled. 1h (R/W) = Prefetch Postwrite engine is enabled.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Select which wait pin edge detector should start the engine in synchronized mode 0h (R/W) = Selects Wait0 EdgeDetection 1h (R/W) = Selects Wait1 EdgeDetection 2h, 3h = Reserved

Selects when the engine starts the access to chip-select 0h (R/W) = Engine starts the access to chip-select as soon as STARTENGINE is set 1h (R/W) = Engine starts the access to chip-select as soon as STARTENGINE is set AND wait to nonwait edge detection on the selected wait pin

Selects interrupt synchronization or DMA request synchronization 0h (R/W) = Interrupt synchronization is enabled. Only interrupt line is activated on FIFO threshold crossing. 1h (R/W) = DMA request synchronization is enabled. A DMA request protocol is used.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Selects prefetch read or write-posting accesses 0h (R/W) = Prefetch read mode 1h (R/W) = Write-posting mode

register.description: Prefetch engine configuration 2

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Selects the number of bytes to be read or written by the engine to the selected chip-select

register.description: Prefetch engine control

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Resets the FIFO pointer and starts the engine Write: 0h = Stops the engine. 1h = Resets the FIFO pointer to 0h in prefetch mode and 40h in postwrite mode and starts the engine. Read: 0h = Engine is stopped. 1h = Engine is running.

register.description: Prefetch engine status

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of available bytes to be read or number of free empty byte places to be written
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Set when FIFOPointer exceeds FIFOThreshold value 0h (R) = FIFOPointer smaller or equal to FIFOThreshold. Writing to this bit has no effect. 1h (R) = FIFOPointer greater than FIFOThreshold. Writing to this bit has no effect.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Number of remaining bytes to be read or to be written by the engine according to the TransferCount value

register.description: ECC configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
ECC algorithm used 0h (R/W) = Hamming code 1h (R/W) = BCH code
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Error correction capability used for BCH 0h (R/W) = Up to 4 bits error correction (t = 4) 1h (R/W) = Up to 8 bits error correction (t = 8) 2h (R/W) = Up to 16 bits error correction (t = 16) 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Spare area organization definition for the BCH algorithm. See the BCH syndrome/parity calculator module functional specification for more details
Selects an ECC calculated on 16 columns 0h (R/W) = ECC calculated on 8 columns 1h (R/W) = ECC calculated on 16 columns
Number of sectors to process with the BCH algorithm 1h = 2 sectors
Selects the CS where ECC is computed 0h (R/W) = CS0 1h (R/W) = CS1 2h (R/W) = CS2 3h (R/W) = CS3 Other: Reserved
Enables the ECC feature 0h (R/W) = ECC disabled 1h (R/W) = ECC enabled

register.description: ECC control

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Clear all ECC result registers
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Selects ECC result register (Reads to this field give the dynamic position of the ECC pointer - Writes to this field select the ECC result register where the first ECC computation will be stored.); Writing other values disables the ECC engine (ECCENABLE bit of 0h (R/W) = Writing 0h disables the ECC engine (ECCENABLE bit of 1h (R/W) = ECC result register 1 selected 2h (R/W) = ECC result register 2 selected 3h (R/W) = ECC result register 3 selected 4h (R/W) = ECC result register 4 selected 5h (R/W) = ECC result register 5 selected 6h (R/W) = ECC result register 6 selected 7h (R/W) = ECC result register 7 selected 8h (R/W) = ECC result register 8 selected 9h (R/W) = ECC result register 9 selected

register.description: ECC size

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 3.
Defines Hamming code ECC size 1 in bytes
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 3.
Defines Hamming code ECC size 0 in bytes
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Selects ECC size for ECC 9 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 8 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 7 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 6 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 5 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 4 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 3 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 2 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected
Selects ECC size for ECC 1 result register 0h (R/W) = ECCSIZE0 selected 1h (R/W) = ECCSIZE1 selected

register.description: ECC result register Offset = 200h + (j * 4h), where: j = 0 to 8

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Odd row parity bit 2048, only used for ECC computed on 512 bytes
Odd row parity bit 1024
Odd row parity bit 512
Odd row parity bit 256
Odd row parity bit 128
Odd row parity bit 64
Odd row parity bit 32
Odd row parity bit 16
Odd row parity bit 8
Odd Column Parity bit 4
Odd Column Parity bit 2
Odd Column Parity bit 1
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Even row parity bit 2048, only used for ECC computed on 512 bytes
Even row parity bit 1024
Even row parity bit 512
Even row parity bit 256
Even row parity bit 128
Even row parity bit 64
Even row parity bit 32
Even row parity bit 16
Even row parity bit 8
Even column parity bit 4
Even column parity bit 2
Even column parity bit 1

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 0 to 31) Offset = 240h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 0 to 31)

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 32 to 63) Offset = 244h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 32 to 63)

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 64 to 95) Offset = 248h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 64 to 95)

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 96 to 127) Offset = 24Ch + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 96 to 127)

register.description: This register is used to directly pass data to the BCH ECC calculator without accessing the actual NAND flash interface.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Data to be included in the BCH calculation

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 128 to 159) Offset = 300h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 128 to 159)

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 160 to 191) Offset = 304h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result (bits 160 to 191)

register.description: BCH ECC result (bits 192 to 207) Offset = 308h + (i * 10h), where: i = 0 to 3

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
BCH ECC result (bits 192 to 207)
